properties.description: The former studio home of the sculptor Dora Gordine and her husband the Hon. Richard Hare, a scholar of Russian art and literature. 1930s house over four floors including a flat roof terrace and views of Richmond Park.
properties.name: Dorich House Museum

properties.description: Highly acclaimed building of red brick with colourful window details and roof, the British Library is the ultimate in post-modernity. The design follows the English Free Style of architecture. RIBA Award Winner.
properties.name: British Library

properties.description: Founded as a Black Death burial ground, the site has served as a Carthusian monastery, Tudor mansion, school and an almshouse, which it remains to this day. The Charterhouse opened to the public in 2017 with a new museum.
properties.name: The Charterhouse

properties.description: Built initially as a vestry, later extended. Victorian and Edwardian interiors with rich tiles and stunning stained glass, one of the most beautiful Victorian interiors in London.
properties.name: Chiswick Town Hall

properties.description: Founded by William the Conqueror's Archbishop Lanfranc in 1080 (the significant crypt survives) St Mary-le-Bow was rebuilt, notably by Wren after the Great Fire and by Laurence King in 1964 after WWII destruction. Home of Bow Bells.
properties.name: The City Churches: St Mary-le-Bow

properties.description: London's main tourist information centre is clad in a specially manufactured system of 220 pre-finished stainless steel panels. The subtly reflective surface provides a striking counterpoint to St Paul's. NOTE: Closed on Monday 19 September
properties.name: City Information Centre

properties.description: St Anne's Limehouse has been described as 'the finest parish church in England.' Designed by Nicholas Hawksmoor, it is Grade I listed and one of the Major Churches in the Church of England. It is home to a thriving Christian congregation.
properties.name: St Anne's Church, Limehouse

properties.description: The town's oldest firm of funeral directors has conducted funerals from these premises since 1908. The original interior is Grade II listed. The building also contains the Frederick W Paine Museum and the firm's archive.
properties.name: Frederick W Paine Funeral Directors

properties.description: The Gilbert & George Centre was originally established as a registered charity by the artist in 2009 with the objective to advance the education of the public in the arts, and generally to advance the arts, architecture, heritage, and culture for the benefit of the public.
properties.name: Gilbert & George Centre

properties.description: A tour round the estate, with visits to residents' homes, information on the original design principles, tenancy types & history plus an opportunity to appreciate the setting with the River Lea bordering the estate. Approx 90 mins.
properties.name: Ferry Lane Estate

properties.description: The King’s Cross Masterplan established a framework for the incremental redevelopment of this industrial heritage site through a mix of uses and a network of public spaces structuring new urban blocks and knitting the site into its context.
properties.name: King's Cross Masterplan

properties.description: Join us to find out more about our incredible journey to create a new museum for London. Apply to join a special tour of the General Market (currently in construction), or come along to meet the architects and take part in free family-friendly drop-in activities.
properties.name: London Museum, West Smithfield

properties.description: UCL PEARL is a brand new building designed to be a laboratory that can "house the world" so that we can create different environments from around the world for experiments about people and the environment around them.
properties.name: UCL PEARL

properties.description: Amongst the RIBA Stirling Prize shortlist 2022 sits Mæ Architect's Sands End Arts & Community scheme in Fulham. The centre consists of a single-storey building comprising bright, airy and flexible event spaces and a community café.
properties.name: Sands End Arts & Community Centre

properties.description: Repurposed out of a disused sausage factory, Grow was converted into a grassroots venue, community hub, bar and kitchen. This canalside venue is part of an ecosystem of artist studios & small independent businesses & working yard.
properties.name: Grow, Hackney
City & Guilds of London Art School

properties.description:
A great little museum set in the Grade 2 listed Ossulston Estate - a prime example of pre-war Social housing - based on Karl Marz Hof in Vienna.
Open Wednesdays to Saturdays throughout Festival 
Sunday 11th Event
properties.name: People's Museum Somers Town

properties.description: Hornsey Library is a Grade II listed building, featuring Huxley-Jones' "Reclining figure" sculpture and the intricately etched glass "Hornsey window". A recent refurbishment has added practical updates while keeping the 1960s aesthetic.
properties.name: Hornsey Library

properties.description: A victorian mid terrace house with a dark blue exterior and a zany tiled front garden. Full of original features without being dictated by the era, colour continues inside with a yellow rubber floor in the kitchen.
properties.name: Havant House 53

properties.description: A walk around historic Walthamstow showing how this unique area grew from a village into a thriving suburb, its social history and the variety of buildings that can be found where Epping Forest meets William Morris.
properties.name: From Forest to Morris: A walk around Walthamstow

properties.description: Poroban is a multi-disciplinary design studio, based off Old Kent Road, specialising in low carbon building design. We are offering free design surgeries throughout September and are hosting an open day on Saturday 9th Sept.
properties.name: Poroban studio

properties.description: Gaunson Creative Studios in South Tottenham, home to over 70 artist studios, will be opening its doors for the first time since 2019. Visitors will be able to meet and buy from over 50 artists across the weekend.
properties.name: Gaunson Creative Open Studios part of Markfield Road Festival

properties.description: Have you ever walked through London and wondered “Where are the statues of women?” or have you ever walked around London and counted the statues of women then tried to do the same with the statues of men?
properties.name: Amazing Women in London Tour

properties.description: An illustrated talk on 8th September by Patrick Hellicar.  Exploring Scruby’s vision, foresight and energy that, in the 1920s and 1930’s, transformed a swathe of indifferent farmland in Kent into a desirable residential garden suburb.
properties.name: Basil Scruby - The Man Who Made Petts Wood

properties.description: Prince Henry’s Room is located at 17 Fleet Street, one of the few buildings in the city that survived the 1666 London Great Fire. The room, on the first floor contains one of the best-preserved Jacobian-enriched plaster ceilings in London.
properties.name: The Prince Henry Room

properties.description: A 2.5 hour walking tour showcasing unexpected and hidden architectural landmarks, both historic and contemporary, of the South Bank area along a route from Lambeth Palace/Garden Museum to Bernie Spain Gardens. Held on 2 weekends.
properties.name: LOST AND HIDDEN ARCHITECTURE OF SOUTH BANK WALK

properties.description: Free access to the final weekend of 'we are a group of people composed of who we are', a survey exhibition that traces artistic, cultural and social collective work that took place in Hackney between 1971 and 1986.
properties.name: Peer

properties.description: 195 Mare Street
properties.name: 195 Mare Street

properties.description: Architecture for London designed and built a new home for stationers Present & Correct in a heritage retail unit. In a nod to the neighbouring British Museum, cabinets as 'wunderkammer' display the stationery as objects of desire.
properties.name: Present & Correct Stationers

properties.description: Discover another side to Stratford beyond the regeneration narratives on this Art and Culture Trail featuring intriguing forgotten histories alongside contemporary stories reflected in the area's public art, local monuments and heritage buildings.
properties.name: Stratford art and culture trail

properties.description: This walking tour explores the nature of community by journeying north of the city along the once Roman route of Ermine Street, exploring the impact of migration and the evolving forms of housing made necessary by London's growth.
properties.name: Shoreditch to De Beauvoir walking tour

properties.description: Imagine a history of smells woven through the streets of a bygone industrial Bermondsey. This walk will explore  & trace the way food has shaped the architecture of the area known as 'London's Larder’ How do we value our food heritage?
properties.name: The architecture of eating- how food shapes our city

properties.description: Explore the Bush Theatre, West London’s home of new writing. Get a behind the scenes look at our fifty-year history, including how over 2016 we transformed our 128-year-old building into an accessible and sustainable modern theatre.
properties.name: Bush Theatre - Backstage Tours

properties.description: On the surface Stratford is all Olympics and Westfield: this tour unearths the area's Roman and religious origins, unusual buildings, famous manufacturing pioneers, 20th century hard times and considers (from above) the impacts of its newest quarter.
properties.name: Stratford: past, present and future

properties.description: Home of NLA, London’s built environment community, and located in the West Wing of the Guildhall complex, the Centre highlights 3 scale architectural models of London: the New London Model, the City Model and the Royal Docks Model.
properties.name: The London Centre

properties.description:
Yorkton Workshops is a newly remodeled building that merges Victorian features with modern industrial details.
House to the design firm Pearson Lloyd.
We are thrilled to show you what we do and where we do it.
properties.name: Yorkton Workshop

properties.description: The creation of new public realm along Strand, south of Aldwych, has been described as the one of the best things to happen to London in years. It is an exemplar of what's possible when road space is reclaimed for people and for nature.
properties.name: Tour of Strand Aldwych
